citations.narrative:
The facility has no guidance provided in their Program of Veterinary Care for the percentage or total number of dogs to be
sampled and the frequency of which they should be tested for heartworm and intestinal parasites. The facility has
conducted heartworm testing and fecal testing on the dogs. However, the testing has not been conducted in accordance
with a written and approved schedule.
Fifty-three adult dogs have not received vaccinations for distemper and parvovirus in accordance with the guidance that is
provided in the Program of Veterinary Care.
Each dealer must follow an appropriate program of veterinary care for dogs that is developed, documented in writing, and
signed by the attending veterinarian and includes vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly disease (including rabies,
parvovirus, and distemper) and sampling and treatment of parasites and other pests. Sampling of dogs for parasites and
providing vaccinations in accordance with the Program of Veterinary Care is necessary to ensure the animals are
receiving adequate veterinary care.
Correct by adding the number or percentage of dogs to be sampled for heartworms and intestinal parasites to the
Program of Veterinary Care and have that schedule approved by the attending veterinarian. Additionally, the facility must
also ensure that all dogs are vaccinated for contagious and/or deadly disease in accordance with the written Program of
Veterinary Care.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 06-May-2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility has no guidance provided in their Program of Veterinary Care for the percentage or total number of dogs to be 
sampled and the frequency of which they should be tested for heartworm and intestinal parasites. The facility has 
conducted heartworm testing and fecal testing on the dogs. However, the testing has not been conducted in accordance 
with a written and approved schedule.  
 
Fifty-three adult dogs have not received vaccinations for distemper and parvovirus in accordance with the guidance that is 
provided in the Program of Veterinary Care.  
 
Each dealer must follow an appropriate program of veterinary care for dogs that is developed, documented in writing, and 
signed by the attending veterinarian and includes vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly disease (including rabies, 
parvovirus, and distemper) and sampling and treatment of parasites and other pests. Sampling of dogs for parasites and 
providing vaccinations in accordance with the Program of Veterinary Care is necessary to ensure the animals are 
receiving adequate veterinary care. 
 
Correct by adding the number or percentage of dogs to be sampled for heartworms and intestinal parasites to the 
Program of Veterinary Care and have that schedule approved by the attending veterinarian. Additionally, the facility must 
also ensure that all dogs are vaccinated for contagious and/or deadly disease in accordance with the written Program of 
Veterinary Care. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 06-May-2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
 n
